tasks.name: Product Concept Design
tasks.description: Develop operational, technical, and functional concepts to understand how the product will be used, what systems are needed, and what functions they'll perform.

subtasks.name: Operational Concept
subtasks.description: Create a flowchart showing the sequence of interactions between users and the product, identifying key interaction points.

completeness.description: The 3 critical interaction points are mentioned: Start/Activation, Stop/Deactivation, and working Mechanisms.
Compare the interaction with old product and possible future concepts(e.g. future lifestyle changes, new technologies)

quality.description: High quality also means users mentioned different interaction points, such as Adjustment, Feedback Mechanisms, Error Handling, Confirmation/Verification, and Emergency Interactions

presentation.description: Present the concept using a clear Human-Product Interaction Diagram.

subtasks.name: Technical Concept
subtasks.description: Describe the technical systems and subsystems needed using a hierarchical representation of the product.

completeness.description: Include basic technical components related to safety such as risks detectors, preventative barriers, and risk confirmation, risk handling, and risk management.
Compare the technical components with old product and possible future components(e.g. new technologies)

quality.description: High quality means the technical components using well-tested and established technologies and complies with relevant safety standards and regulations
High quality also means a plan to integrate the components into the product is mentioned.

presentation.description: Present the concept using a clear Tree Diagram.

subtasks.name: Functional Concept
subtasks.description: Describe the functions that the systems will perform.

completeness.description: Address the function of the product components

quality.description: Mention the link between the function of the components and users needs.

presentation.description: Present the concept using a clear Tree Diagram.

tasks.name: Identify and Reflect on Environmental Factors
tasks.description: Identify how environmental factors (both physical and non-physical) can impact the product.

completeness.description: Consider both physical and non-physical environmental factors.
Analyze the impact of these factors on the product.

quality.description: Provide a clear analysis of how each factor affects the product and versa.
Consider both immediate and long-term impacts of environmental factors.

presentation.description: Clearly categorize factors into physical and non-physical groups.

step_overview.introduction: This step focuses on evaluate a clear product vision through concept design and considering environmental factors.

main_components.name: Product Concept Design
main_components.description: Develop operational, technical, and functional concepts to understand how the product will be used, what systems are needed, and what functions they'll perform.

main_components.name: Environmental Factors
main_components.description: Analyze physical (e.g., weather, working conditions) and non-physical (e.g., regulations, policies) factors that could affect the product.

concept_design_subtasks.name: Operational Concept

steps: Narrow down to the main interactions

GPT helps modify components based on users' needs

concept_design_subtasks.name: Functional Concept
concept_design_subtasks.description: Describe the functions that the systems will perform.
steps: Users choose parts of the technical concept to translate into a functional diagram
GPT suggests a functional concept based on the chosen components
Users review and modify the functional components as necessary
